description: Retention of hardstanding to the front garden area, including vehicle crossover and two parking spaces.
decision_conditions: <p><span id="docs-internal-guid-a3acf0dd-7fff-80a6-5405-e5ed72a1785a"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">The proposed development, by reason of the loss of the front boundary treatment and garden area and replacement with hardstanding, detracts from the character and visual appearance of the area, to the detriment&nbsp;of the visual amenity of the site, wider terrace and surrounding public realm. As such, the proposal is contrary to policies&nbsp; D3 (Optimising site capacity through the design-led approach) and D4 (Delivering good design) of the London Plan (2021) and policies PP1 (Public Realm), LP1 (Design Quality and Local Character), of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 (2020) and guidance contained within Hackney Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD (2009).</span></span><br></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-2986980a-7fff-3fa4-31bb-9e318f177759"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">The hardstanding to the front garden, results in the loss of soft landscaping, including verdant land, trees and hedges which would result in a loss of biodiversity at the site, </span><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">the proposal is therefore contrary to policies G1 (Green infrastructure)&nbsp; and G6 (Biodiversity and access to nature) of the London Plan (2021) and policies LP46 (Protection and Enhancement of Green Infrastructure) and LP47 (Biodiversity and Sites of Importance of Nature Conservation) of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 (2020).&nbsp;</span></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-3c64e79f-7fff-ef79-9ea5-35d411e66319"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">The vehicle crossover, by reason of facilitating&nbsp;</span>vehicles manoeuvring in and out of the site over the pavement&nbsp;<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">at a busy location between a bus stop and Hackney Downs Overground Station, would have a detrimental impact on highway and pedestrian safety and the safe and efficient operation of the public highway. As such the proposal is contrary to policy T4 (</span><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">Assessing and mitigating transport impacts) of </span><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">&nbsp;the London Plan (2021) and policies LP41 (Livable Neighbourhoods), LP43 (Transport and Development) and LP44 (Public Transport and Infrastructure) </span><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 (2020).&nbsp;</span></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-5a240ad2-7fff-a19e-0797-daf6eb20946e"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">The provision of off-street parking spaces at a site with PTAL 6a (excellent) rating fails to promote sustainable modes of transport and does not promote car free residential development, contrary to policy T6.1 (Residential parking) of the London Plan (2021) and policies LP43 (Transport and Development)&nbsp; and LP45 (Parking and Car Free Development) </span><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 (2020). </span></span><br></p>
